chapters.title: Food: Where Does It Come From?
chapters.videoTopic: Food Journey 3D – From Plants & Animals To Our Plate
chapters.summary: Food comes from plants and animals. We eat different parts of plants like roots, stems, leaves, fruits and seeds. Animals provide milk, eggs, meat and honey. Different regions have different food habits. Animals are grouped into herbivores, carnivores and omnivores based on what they eat.
points: Food comes from plants and animals
Plant parts used as food: roots, stems, leaves, fruits, seeds
Animals give milk, meat, eggs, honey
wordMeanings: Food – Something we eat to live
Omnivore – Eats both plants and animals
Dairy Products – Foods made from milk
Grains – Wheat, rice etc used for food
Ingredient – Item used to prepare food
funFacts: Bees visit 50–100 flowers to make one drop of honey
Every corn cob has even number of kernels
chapters.history: Early humans hunted and gathered. Later they learned farming and food storage like in Indus Valley Civilization.

chapters.title: Components of Food
chapters.videoTopic: Inside the Human Body 3D – Power of Nutrients and Balanced Diet
chapters.summary: Food contains nutrients like carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins and minerals. Carbohydrates give energy, proteins help growth, fats store energy, vitamins and minerals protect health, roughage helps digestion and water is essential. Lack of nutrients causes deficiency diseases.
wordMeanings: Balanced Diet – Right mix of nutrients
Malnutrition – Poor health due to lack of nutrients
chapters.history: Earlier people didn’t know nutrients. Scientists later discovered vitamins and minerals.

chapters.title: Fibre to Fabric
chapters.videoTopic: Cotton to Cloth 3D – Journey from Plant to Fabric
chapters.summary: Clothes are made from fibres like cotton and jute. Fibres → yarn → fabric through spinning, weaving and knitting. Natural fibres come from plants and animals; synthetic fibres are man-made.
chapters.history: Indus Valley used cotton cloth. Later spinning wheel and machines were invented.
